content: bottom of the work together chain 1 turn your work so that the sl sts are facing inwards at this point i suggest trying your work on this should fit snuggly around your waist with the work slightly stretched it should not be too tight as the rounds will become tighter when worked up from the ribbing @hooked graces 4 next row put the first double_crochet into the last slip_stitch completed work r double crochets along the edge of the work that you have just completed making sure to evenly distribute them along the ribbing slip_stitch into the first double_crochet of the round turn ex my work was 84 row so i worked 84 double crochets along the edge of my work round 1 double_crochet into the first slip_stitch of the last round every first st of the round should be completed in the same way double_crochet along round slip_stitch to beginning of the round turn round 2-27 repeat round 1 this can be completed until row 27 or you can alter the number of rounds depending on how long you want the garment to be the top of the work should stop slightly below your breasts with the work ending where desired at this point you need to take your stitch number this should be the same as in round 1 and calculate 2 numbers stitch a divide your stitch count by 6 and round up to the nearest whole number stitch b minus stitch a from your total stitch count place a stitch marker on stitch a and another on stitch b cast off your work ex my total stitch count was 84 stitch a 84 / 6 = 14 stitch b 84 14 = 70 front panel this will now section off from the main body and be worked in the flat row 1 on the right side attach your yarn with a slip_stitch to stitch a chain 1 double_crochet into this same st and along row until you reach stitch b placing a double_crochet into this stitch chain 1 turn @hooked graces 5 row 2 double_crochet across all sts of the row chain 1 turn row 3 blo double_crochet across all sts of the row chain 1 turn row 4 decrease double_crochet across sts until 2nd to last st decrease chain 1 turn row 5-22 repeat row 3 and 4 row 23 double_crochet along row chain 1 turn row 24 decrease double_crochet across sts until 2nd to last st decrease chain 1 turn row 25-32 repeat row 23 and 24 this can be carried on until row 32 or can be finished when desired cast off weave your ends in and block your work blocking is not a necessary step in the pattern but it is recommended border and halter neck straps row 1 at this point you will begin chaining the length that you want for your first neck strap i suggest anywhere from 60 chains upwards but this can alter depending on your body
